title: Caribbean Nut-Crusted Fish
summary: The recipe Caribbean Nut-Crusted Fish is ready in approximately 27 minutes and is definitely a spectacular gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian option for lovers of Central American food. One portion of this dish contains about 4g of protein, 1g of fat, and a total of 46 calories. For 56 cents per serving, this recipe covers 4% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 27. Only a few people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. If you have planters nuts, cilantro, garlic, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. With a spoonacular score of 64%, this dish is solid. Try Caribbean Chutney-Crusted Chops, Caribbean fish, and Ed's Caribbean Fish Sauce for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish works really well with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Alsace Willm Pinot Gris Reserve with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 16 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Alsace Willm Pinot Gris Reserve
productMatches.description: An intense golden color with hints of ocher, the wine has a nose of ripe fruit, quince. In the mouth the attack is both supple and full, with notes of honey and spices. The final perfectly balances sugar and acidity.Pair this wine alongside pan-fried foie gras, grilled or roasted white meats (pork, veal), rabbit, poultry in cream sauce, smoked fish, mushroom dishes such as risotto.

instructions: Heat oven to 375F.                                            Combine nuts, cilantro, garlic, oil and zest until well blended; set aside.                                            Place fish on lightly greased baking sheet; drizzle with lime juice.  Top with nut mixture; press lightly into fish to secure.                                              Bake 10 to 12 min. or until fish flakes easily with fork.  Meanwhile, cook broccoli as directed on package.  Serve fish with the broccoli and rice.

steps.step: Combine nuts, cilantro, garlic, oil and zest until well blended; set aside.
Place fish on lightly greased baking sheet; drizzle with lime juice.  Top with nut mixture; press lightly into fish to secure.
Bake 10 to 12 min. or until fish flakes easily with fork.  Meanwhile, cook broccoli as directed on package.
Serve fish with the broccoli and rice.
